meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a troglodyte.
meanings.sent1: The dark, damp cave had a troglodytic feel to it.
meanings.sent2: The troglodytic drawings on the cave walls depicted ancient life.
meanings.sent3: The troglodytic creature peeked out from its hiding spot, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His troglodytic behavior made him stand out in the modern world.
meanings.sent5: The troglodytic smell of the cave lingered in the air, reminding them of ancient times.

meanings.definition: Relating to or living in a cave.
meanings.sent1: The troglodytic bats hung upside down in the dark cave.
meanings.sent2: Explorers discovered troglodytic artifacts deep within the cave system.
meanings.sent3: The troglodytic echoes in the cave made their voices sound mysterious.
meanings.sent4: Her troglodytic home was cozy and secluded from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The troglodytic silence of the cave enveloped them in a peaceful embrace.

meanings.sent1: The troglodytic tribes lived off the land, following ancient traditions.
meanings.sent2: His troglodytic manners shocked the sophisticated guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The troglodytic dance they performed was both amusing and endearing.
meanings.sent4: In a world of technology, his troglodytic ways seemed out of place.
meanings.sent5: The troglodytic language they spoke was filled with guttural sounds and simple words.
